contents.verseText: These are the proverbs of Solomon son of David, king of Israel,
contents: These are the proverbs of Solomon son of David,
king of Israel,

contents.verseText: for gaining wisdom and discipline, for comprehending words of insight,
contents: for gaining wisdom and discipline,
for comprehending words of insight,

contents.verseText: and for receiving instruction in wise living and in righteousness, justice, and equity.
contents: and for receiving instruction in wise living
and in righteousness, justice, and equity.

contents.verseText: To impart prudence to the simple and knowledge and discretion to the young,
contents: To impart prudence to the simple

footnote.ft: The Hebrew word rendered simple in Proverbs refers to one who is naive, without moral direction, or inclined to evil.

contents: and knowledge and discretion to the young,

contents.verseText: let the wise listen and gain instruction, and the discerning acquire wise counsel
contents: let the wise listen and gain instruction,
and the discerning acquire wise counsel

contents.verseText: by understanding the proverbs and parables, the sayings and riddles of the wise.
contents: by understanding the proverbs and parables,
the sayings and riddles of the wise.

contents.verseText: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and discipline.
contents: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge,
but fools

footnote.ft: The Hebrew words rendered as fool in Proverbs denote one who is morally deficient.

contents: despise wisdom and discipline.

contents.verseText: Listen, my son, to your father’s instruction, and do not forsake the teaching of your mother.
contents: Listen, my son, to your father’s instruction,
and do not forsake the teaching of your mother.

contents.verseText: For they are a garland of grace on your head and a pendant around your neck.
contents: For they are a garland of grace on your head
and a pendant around your neck.

contents.verseText: My son, if sinners entice you, do not yield to them.
contents: My son, if sinners entice you,
do not yield to them.

contents.verseText: If they say, “Come along, let us lie in wait for blood, let us ambush the innocent without cause,
contents: If they say, “Come along, let us lie in wait for blood,
let us ambush the innocent without cause,

contents.verseText: let us swallow them alive like Sheol, and whole like those descending into the Pit.
contents: let us swallow them alive like Sheol,
and whole like those descending into the Pit.

contents.verseText: We will find all manner of precious goods; we will fill our houses with plunder.
contents: We will find all manner of precious goods;
we will fill our houses with plunder.

contents.verseText: Throw in your lot with us; let us all share one purse”—
contents: Throw in your lot with us;
let us all share one purse”—

contents.verseText: my son, do not walk the road with them or set foot upon their path.
contents: my son, do not walk the road with them
or set foot upon their path.

contents.verseText: For their feet run to evil, and they are swift to shed blood.
contents: For their feet run to evil,
and they are swift to shed blood.

contents.verseText: How futile it is to spread the net where any bird can see it!
contents: How futile it is to spread the net
where any bird can see it!

contents.verseText: But they lie in wait for their own blood; they ambush their own lives.
contents: But they lie in wait for their own blood;
they ambush their own lives.

contents.verseText: Such is the fate of all who are greedy, whose unjust gain takes the lives of its possessors.
contents: Such is the fate of all who are greedy,
whose unjust gain takes the lives of its possessors.

contents.verseText: Wisdom calls out in the street, she lifts her voice in the square;
contents: Wisdom calls out in the street,
she lifts her voice in the square;

contents.verseText: in the main concourse she cries aloud, at the city gates she makes her speech:
contents: in the main concourse

footnote.ft: Or from the top of the wall

contents: she cries aloud,
at the city gates she makes her speech:

contents.verseText: “How long, O simple ones, will you love your simple ways? How long will scoffers delight in their scorn and fools hate knowledge?
contents: “How long, O simple ones, will you love your simple ways?
How long will scoffers delight in their scorn
and fools hate knowledge?

contents.verseText: If you had repented at my rebuke, then surely I would have poured out my spirit on you; I would have made my words known to you.
contents: If you had repented at my rebuke,
then surely I would have poured out my spirit on you;
I would have made my words known to you.

contents.verseText: Because you refused my call, and no one took my outstretched hand,
contents: Because you refused my call,
and no one took my outstretched hand,

contents.verseText: because you neglected all my counsel, and wanted none of my correction,
contents: because you neglected all my counsel,
and wanted none of my correction,

contents.verseText: in turn I will mock your calamity; I will sneer when terror strikes you,
contents: in turn I will mock your calamity;
I will sneer when terror strikes you,

contents.verseText: when your dread comes like a storm, and your destruction like a whirlwind, when distress and anguish overwhelm you.
contents: when your dread comes like a storm,
and your destruction like a whirlwind,
when distress and anguish overwhelm you.

contents.verseText: Then they will call on me, but I will not answer; they will earnestly seek me, but will not find me.
contents: Then they will call on me, but I will not answer;
they will earnestly seek me, but will not find me.

contents.verseText: For they hated knowledge and chose not to fear the LORD.
contents: For they hated knowledge
and chose not to fear the LORD.

contents.verseText: They accepted none of my counsel; they despised all my reproof.
contents: They accepted none of my counsel;
they despised all my reproof.

contents.verseText: So they will eat the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own devices.
contents: So they will eat the fruit of their own way,
and be filled with their own devices.

contents.verseText: For the waywardness of the simple will slay them, and the complacency of fools will destroy them.
contents: For the waywardness of the simple will slay them,
and the complacency of fools will destroy them.

contents.verseText: But whoever listens to me will dwell in safety, secure from the fear of evil.”
contents: But whoever listens to me will dwell in safety,
secure from the fear of evil.”

contents.verseText: My son, if you accept my words and hide my commandments within you,
contents: My son, if you accept my words
and hide my commandments within you,

contents.verseText: if you incline your ear to wisdom and direct your heart to understanding,
contents: if you incline your ear to wisdom
and direct your heart to understanding,

contents.verseText: if you truly call out to insight and lift your voice to understanding,
contents: if you truly call out to insight
and lift your voice to understanding,

contents.verseText: if you seek it like silver and search it out like hidden treasure,
contents: if you seek it like silver
and search it out like hidden treasure,

contents.verseText: then you will discern the fear of the LORD and discover the knowledge of God.
contents: then you will discern the fear of the LORD
and discover the knowledge of God.

contents.verseText: For the LORD gives wisdom; from His mouth come knowledge and understanding.
contents: For the LORD gives wisdom;
from His mouth come knowledge and understanding.

contents.verseText: He stores up sound wisdom for the upright; He is a shield to those who walk with integrity,
contents: He stores up sound wisdom for the upright;
He is a shield to those who walk with integrity,

contents.verseText: to guard the paths of justice and protect the way of His saints.
contents: to guard the paths of justice
and protect the way of His saints.

contents.verseText: Then you will discern righteousness and justice and equity—every good path.
contents: Then you will discern righteousness
and justice and equity—every good path.

contents.verseText: For wisdom will enter your heart, and knowledge will delight your soul.
contents: For wisdom will enter your heart,
and knowledge will delight your soul.

contents.verseText: Discretion will watch over you, and understanding will guard you,
contents: Discretion will watch over you,
and understanding will guard you,

contents.verseText: to deliver you from the way of evil, from the man who speaks perversity,
contents: to deliver you from the way of evil,
from the man who speaks perversity,

contents.verseText: from those who leave the straight paths to walk in the ways of darkness,
contents: from those who leave the straight paths
to walk in the ways of darkness,

contents.verseText: from those who enjoy doing evil and rejoice in the twistedness of evil,
contents: from those who enjoy doing evil
and rejoice in the twistedness of evil,

contents.verseText: whose paths are crooked and whose ways are devious.
contents: whose paths are crooked
and whose ways are devious.

contents.verseText: It will rescue you from the forbidden woman, from the stranger with seductive words
contents: It will rescue you from the forbidden woman,

footnote.ft: Or wayward wife

contents: from the stranger

footnote.ft: Or adulteress

contents: with seductive words

contents.verseText: who abandons the partner of her youth and forgets the covenant of her God.
contents: who abandons the partner of her youth
and forgets the covenant of her God.

contents.verseText: For her house sinks down to death, and her tracks to the departed spirits.
contents: For her house sinks down to death,
and her tracks to the departed spirits.

footnote.ft: Hebrew to the Rephaim

contents.verseText: None who go to her return or negotiate the paths of life.
contents: None who go to her return
or negotiate the paths of life.

contents.verseText: So you will follow in the ways of the good, and keep to the paths of the righteous.
contents: So you will follow in the ways of the good,
and keep to the paths of the righteous.

contents.verseText: For the upright will inhabit the land, and the blameless will remain in it;
contents: For the upright will inhabit the land,
and the blameless will remain in it;

contents.verseText: but the wicked will be cut off from the land, and the unfaithful will be uprooted.
contents: but the wicked will be cut off from the land,
and the unfaithful will be uprooted.

s1: Trust in the LORD with All Your Heart

contents.verseText: My son, do not forget my teaching, but let your heart keep my commandments;
contents: My son, do not forget my teaching,
but let your heart keep my commandments;

contents.verseText: for they will add length to your days, years and peace to your life.
contents: for they will add length to your days,
years and peace to your life.

contents.verseText: Never let loving devotion or faithfulness leave you; bind them around your neck, write them on the tablet of your heart.
contents: Never let loving devotion

footnote.ft: Forms of the Hebrew chesed are translated here and in most cases throughout the Scriptures as loving devotion; the range of meaning includes love, goodness, kindness, faithfulness, and mercy, as well as loyalty to a covenant.

contents: or faithfulness leave you;
bind them around your neck,
write them on the tablet of your heart.

contents.verseText: Then you will find favor and high regard in the sight of God and man.
contents: Then you will find favor and high regard
in the sight of God and man.

contents.verseText: Trust in the LORD with all your heart, and lean not on your own understanding;
contents: Trust in the LORD with all your heart,
and lean not on your own understanding;

contents.verseText: in all your ways acknowledge Him, and He will make your paths straight.
contents: in all your ways acknowledge Him,
and He will make your paths straight.

contents.verseText: Be not wise in your own eyes; fear the LORD and turn away from evil.
contents: Be not wise in your own eyes;
fear the LORD and turn away from evil.

contents.verseText: This will bring healing to your body and refreshment to your bones.
contents: This will bring healing to your body

footnote.ft: Hebrew navel

contents: and refreshment

footnote.ft: Or medicine

contents: to your bones.

contents.verseText: Honor the LORD with your wealth and with the firstfruits of all your harvest;
contents: Honor the LORD with your wealth
and with the firstfruits of all your harvest;

contents.verseText: then your barns will be filled with plenty, and your vats will overflow with new wine.
contents: then your barns will be filled with plenty,
and your vats will overflow with new wine.

contents.verseText: My son, do not reject the discipline of the LORD, and do not loathe His rebuke;
contents: My son, do not reject the discipline of the LORD,
and do not loathe His rebuke;

footnote.ft: LXX and do not lose heart when He rebukes; cited in Hebrews 12:5

contents.verseText: for the LORD disciplines the one He loves, as does a father the son in whom he delights.
contents: for the LORD disciplines the one He loves,
as does a father the son in whom he delights.

footnote.ft: LXX and He flogs every son He receives; cited in Hebrews 12:6

contents.verseText: Blessed is the man who finds wisdom, the man who acquires understanding,
contents: Blessed is the man who finds wisdom,
the man who acquires understanding,

contents.verseText: for she is more profitable than silver, and her gain is better than fine gold.
contents: for she is more profitable than silver,
and her gain is better than fine gold.

contents.verseText: She is more precious than rubies; nothing you desire compares with her.
contents: She is more precious than rubies;
nothing you desire compares with her.

contents.verseText: Long life is in her right hand; in her left hand are riches and honor.
contents: Long life is in her right hand;
in her left hand are riches and honor.

contents.verseText: All her ways are pleasant, and all her paths are peaceful.
contents: All her ways are pleasant,
and all her paths are peaceful.

contents.verseText: She is a tree of life to those who embrace her, and those who lay hold of her are blessed.
contents: She is a tree of life to those who embrace her,
and those who lay hold of her are blessed.

contents.verseText: The LORD founded the earth by wisdom and established the heavens by understanding.
contents: The LORD founded the earth by wisdom
and established the heavens by understanding.

contents.verseText: By His knowledge the watery depths were broken open, and the clouds dripped with dew.
contents: By His knowledge the watery depths were broken open,
and the clouds dripped with dew.

contents.verseText: My son, do not lose sight of this: Preserve sound judgment and discernment.
contents: My son, do not lose sight of this:
Preserve sound judgment and discernment.

contents.verseText: They will be life to your soul and adornment to your neck.
contents: They will be life to your soul
and adornment to your neck.

contents.verseText: Then you will go on your way in safety, and your foot will not stumble.
contents: Then you will go on your way in safety,
and your foot will not stumble.

contents.verseText: When you lie down, you will not be afraid; when you rest, your sleep will be sweet.
contents: When you lie down, you will not be afraid;
when you rest, your sleep will be sweet.

contents.verseText: Do not fear sudden danger or the ruin that overtakes the wicked,
contents: Do not fear sudden danger
or the ruin that overtakes the wicked,

contents.verseText: for the LORD will be your confidence and will keep your foot from the snare.
contents: for the LORD will be your confidence
and will keep your foot from the snare.

contents.verseText: Do not withhold good from the deserving when it is within your power to act.
contents: Do not withhold good from the deserving

footnote.ft: Or from its owners

contents: when it is within your power to act.

contents.verseText: Do not tell your neighbor, “Come back tomorrow and I will provide”—when you already have the means.
contents: Do not tell your neighbor,
“Come back tomorrow and I will provide”—
when you already have the means.

contents.verseText: Do not devise evil against your neighbor, for he trustfully dwells beside you.
contents: Do not devise evil against your neighbor,
for he trustfully dwells beside you.

contents.verseText: Do not accuse a man without cause, when he has done you no harm.
contents: Do not accuse a man without cause,
when he has done you no harm.

contents.verseText: Do not envy a violent man or choose any of his ways;
contents: Do not envy a violent man
or choose any of his ways;

contents.verseText: for the LORD detests the perverse, but He is a friend to the upright.
contents: for the LORD detests the perverse,
but He is a friend to the upright.

contents.verseText: The curse of the LORD is on the house of the wicked, but He blesses the home of the righteous.
contents: The curse of the LORD is on the house of the wicked,
but He blesses the home of the righteous.

contents.verseText: He mocks the mockers, but gives grace to the humble.
contents: He mocks the mockers,
but gives grace to the humble.

footnote.ft: LXX The Lord opposes the proud, but gives grace to the humble; cited in James 4:6 and 1 Peter 5:5

contents.verseText: The wise will inherit honor, but fools are held up to shame.
contents: The wise will inherit honor,
but fools are held up to shame.

contents.verseText: Listen, my sons, to a father’s instruction; pay attention and gain understanding.
contents: Listen, my sons, to a father’s instruction;
pay attention and gain understanding.

contents.verseText: For I give you sound teaching; do not abandon my directive.
contents: For I give you sound teaching;
do not abandon my directive.

contents.verseText: When I was a son to my father, tender and the only child of my mother,
contents: When I was a son to my father,
tender and the only child of my mother,

contents.verseText: he taught me and said, “Let your heart lay hold of my words; keep my commands and you will live.
contents: he taught me and said,
“Let your heart lay hold of my words;
keep my commands and you will live.

contents.verseText: Get wisdom, get understanding; do not forget my words or turn from them.
contents: Get wisdom, get understanding;
do not forget my words or turn from them.

contents.verseText: Do not forsake wisdom, and she will preserve you; love her, and she will guard you.
contents: Do not forsake wisdom, and she will preserve you;
love her, and she will guard you.

contents.verseText: Wisdom is supreme; so acquire wisdom. And whatever you may acquire, gain understanding.
contents: Wisdom is supreme; so acquire wisdom.
And whatever you may acquire,

footnote.ft: Or And whatever else you acquire

contents: gain understanding.

contents.verseText: Prize her, and she will exalt you; if you embrace her, she will honor you.
contents: Prize her, and she will exalt you;
if you embrace her, she will honor you.

contents.verseText: She will set a garland of grace on your head; she will present you with a crown of beauty.”
contents: She will set a garland of grace on your head;
she will present you with a crown of beauty.”

contents.verseText: Listen, my son, and receive my words, and the years of your life will be many.
contents: Listen, my son, and receive my words,
and the years of your life will be many.

contents.verseText: I will guide you in the way of wisdom; I will lead you on straight paths.
contents: I will guide you in the way of wisdom;
I will lead you on straight paths.

contents.verseText: When you walk, your steps will not be impeded; when you run, you will not stumble.
contents: When you walk, your steps will not be impeded;
when you run, you will not stumble.

contents.verseText: Hold on to instruction; do not let go. Guard it, for it is your life.
contents: Hold on to instruction; do not let go.
Guard it, for it is your life.

contents.verseText: Do not set foot on the path of the wicked or walk in the way of evildoers.
contents: Do not set foot on the path of the wicked
or walk in the way of evildoers.

contents.verseText: Avoid it; do not travel on it. Turn from it and pass on by.
contents: Avoid it; do not travel on it.
Turn from it and pass on by.

contents.verseText: For they cannot sleep unless they do evil; they are deprived of slumber until they make someone fall.
contents: For they cannot sleep
unless they do evil;
they are deprived of slumber
until they make someone fall.

contents.verseText: For they eat the bread of wickedness and drink the wine of violence.
contents: For they eat the bread of wickedness
and drink the wine of violence.

contents.verseText: The path of the righteous is like the first gleam of dawn, shining brighter and brighter until midday.
contents: The path of the righteous is like the first gleam of dawn,
shining brighter and brighter until midday.

contents.verseText: But the way of the wicked is like the darkest gloom; they do not know what makes them stumble.
contents: But the way of the wicked is like the darkest gloom;
they do not know what makes them stumble.

contents.verseText: My son, pay attention to my words; incline your ear to my sayings.
contents: My son, pay attention to my words;
incline your ear to my sayings.

contents.verseText: Do not lose sight of them; keep them within your heart.
contents: Do not lose sight of them;
keep them within your heart.

contents.verseText: For they are life to those who find them, and health to the whole body.
contents: For they are life to those who find them,
and health to the whole body.

contents.verseText: Guard your heart with all diligence, for from it flow springs of life.
contents: Guard your heart with all diligence,
for from it flow springs of life.

contents.verseText: Put away deception from your mouth; keep your lips from perverse speech.
contents: Put away deception from your mouth;
keep your lips from perverse speech.

contents.verseText: Let your eyes look forward; fix your gaze straight ahead.
contents: Let your eyes look forward;
fix your gaze straight ahead.

contents.verseText: Make a level path for your feet, and all your ways will be sure.
contents: Make a level path for your feet,

footnote.ft: Or Ponder the path for your feet; LXX Make straight paths for your feet; cited in Hebrews 12:13

contents: and all your ways will be sure.

contents.verseText: Do not swerve to the right or to the left; turn your feet away from evil.
contents: Do not swerve to the right or to the left;
turn your feet away from evil.

contents.verseText: My son, pay attention to my wisdom; incline your ear to my insight,
contents: My son, pay attention to my wisdom;
incline your ear to my insight,

contents.verseText: that you may maintain discretion and your lips may preserve knowledge.
contents: that you may maintain discretion
and your lips may preserve knowledge.

contents.verseText: Though the lips of the forbidden woman drip honey and her speech is smoother than oil,
contents: Though the lips of the forbidden woman

footnote.ft: Or the adulteress

contents: drip honey
and her speech

footnote.ft: Or her palate

contents: is smoother than oil,

contents.verseText: in the end she is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a double-edged sword.
contents: in the end she is bitter as wormwood,
sharp as a double-edged sword.

contents.verseText: Her feet go down to death; her steps lead straight to Sheol.
contents: Her feet go down to death;
her steps lead straight to Sheol.

footnote.ft: Or lay hold of Sheol

contents.verseText: She does not consider the path of life; she does not know that her ways are unstable.
contents: She does not consider the path of life;
she does not know that her ways are unstable.

contents.verseText: So now, my sons, listen to me, and do not turn aside from the words of my mouth.
contents: So now, my sons, listen to me,
and do not turn aside from the words of my mouth.

contents.verseText: Keep your path far from her; do not go near the door of her house,
contents: Keep your path far from her;
do not go near the door of her house,

contents.verseText: lest you concede your vigor to others, and your years to one who is cruel;
contents: lest you concede your vigor to others,
and your years to one who is cruel;

contents.verseText: lest strangers feast on your wealth, and your labors enrich the house of a foreigner.
contents: lest strangers feast on your wealth,
and your labors enrich the house of a foreigner.

contents.verseText: At the end of your life you will groan when your flesh and your body are spent,
contents: At the end of your life you will groan
when your flesh and your body are spent,

contents.verseText: and you will say, “How I hated discipline, and my heart despised reproof!
contents: and you will say, “How I hated discipline,
and my heart despised reproof!

contents.verseText: I did not listen to the voice of my teachers or incline my ear to my mentors.
contents: I did not listen to the voice of my teachers
or incline my ear to my mentors.

contents.verseText: I am on the brink of utter ruin in the midst of the whole assembly.”
contents: I am on the brink of utter ruin
in the midst of the whole assembly.”

contents.verseText: Drink water from your own cistern, and running water from your own well.
contents: Drink water from your own cistern,
and running water from your own well.

contents.verseText: Why should your springs flow in the streets, your streams of water in the public squares?
contents: Why should your springs flow in the streets,
your streams of water in the public squares?

contents.verseText: Let them be yours alone, never to be shared with strangers.
contents: Let them be yours alone,
never to be shared with strangers.

contents.verseText: May your fountain be blessed, and may you rejoice in the wife of your youth:
contents: May your fountain be blessed,
and may you rejoice in the wife of your youth:

contents.verseText: A loving doe, a graceful fawn—may her breasts satisfy you always; may you be captivated by her love forever.
contents: A loving doe, a graceful fawn—
may her breasts satisfy you always;
may you be captivated

footnote.ft: Or be led astray; also in verse 20

contents: by her love forever.

contents.verseText: Why be captivated, my son, by an adulteress, or embrace the bosom of a stranger?
contents: Why be captivated, my son, by an adulteress,
or embrace the bosom of a stranger?

footnote.ft: Or a foreign woman or another man’s wife

contents.verseText: For a man’s ways are before the eyes of the LORD, and the LORD examines all his paths.
contents: For a man’s ways are before the eyes of the LORD,
and the LORD examines

footnote.ft: Or ponders or makes level

contents: all his paths.

contents.verseText: The iniquities of a wicked man entrap him; the cords of his sin entangle him.
contents: The iniquities of a wicked man entrap him;
the cords of his sin entangle him.

contents.verseText: He dies for lack of discipline, led astray by his own great folly.
contents: He dies for lack of discipline,
led astray by his own great folly.

contents.verseText: My son, if you have put up security for your neighbor, if you have struck hands in pledge with a stranger,
contents: My son, if you have put up security for your neighbor,
if you have struck hands in pledge with a stranger,

contents.verseText: if you have been trapped by the words of your lips, ensnared by the words of your mouth,
contents: if you have been trapped by the words of your lips,
ensnared by the words of your mouth,

contents.verseText: then do this, my son, to free yourself, for you have fallen into your neighbor’s hands: Go, humble yourself, and press your plea with your neighbor.
contents: then do this, my son, to free yourself,
for you have fallen into your neighbor’s hands:
Go, humble yourself,

footnote.ft: Or hasten

contents: and press your plea with your neighbor.

contents.verseText: Allow no sleep to your eyes or slumber to your eyelids.
contents: Allow no sleep to your eyes
or slumber to your eyelids.

contents.verseText: Free yourself, like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter, like a bird from the snare of the fowler.
contents: Free yourself, like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter,

footnote.ft: Hebrew does not include of the hunter.

contents: like a bird from the snare of the fowler.

contents.verseText: Walk in the manner of the ant, O slacker; observe its ways and become wise.
contents: Walk in the manner of the ant, O slacker;
observe its ways and become wise.

contents.verseText: Without a commander, without an overseer or ruler,
contents: Without a commander,
without an overseer or ruler,

contents.verseText: it prepares its provisions in summer; it gathers its food at harvest.
contents: it prepares its provisions in summer;
it gathers its food at harvest.

contents.verseText: How long will you lie there, O slacker? When will you get up from your sleep?
contents: How long will you lie there, O slacker?
When will you get up from your sleep?

contents.verseText: A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest,
contents: A little sleep, a little slumber,
a little folding of the hands to rest,

contents.verseText: and poverty will come upon you like a robber, and need like a bandit.
contents: and poverty will come upon you like a robber,
and need like a bandit.

contents.verseText: A worthless person, a wicked man, walks with a perverse mouth,
contents: A worthless person, a wicked man,
walks with a perverse mouth,

contents.verseText: winking his eyes, speaking with his feet, and pointing with his fingers.
contents: winking his eyes, speaking with his feet,
and pointing with his fingers.

contents.verseText: With deceit in his heart he devises evil; he continually sows discord.
contents: With deceit in his heart he devises evil;
he continually sows discord.

contents.verseText: Therefore calamity will come upon him suddenly; in an instant he will be shattered beyond recovery.
contents: Therefore calamity will come upon him suddenly;
in an instant he will be shattered beyond recovery.

contents.verseText: There are six things that the LORD hates, seven that are detestable to Him: 1
contents: There are six things that the LORD hates, seven that are detestable to Him:

contents.verseText: haughty eyes, a lying tongue, hands that shed innocent blood, 1
contents: haughty eyes,

contents.verseText: a heart that devises wicked schemes, feet that run swiftly to evil, 1
contents: a heart that devises wicked schemes,

li1: feet that run swiftly to evil,

contents.verseText: a false witness who gives false testimony, and one who stirs up discord among brothers.
contents: a false witness who gives false testimony,

li1: and one who stirs up discord among brothers.

contents.verseText: My son, keep your father’s commandment, and do not forsake your mother’s teaching.
contents: My son, keep your father’s commandment,
and do not forsake your mother’s teaching.

contents.verseText: Bind them always upon your heart; tie them around your neck.
contents: Bind them always upon your heart;
tie them around your neck.

contents.verseText: When you walk, they will guide you; when you lie down, they will watch over you; when you awake, they will speak to you.
contents: When you walk, they will guide you;
when you lie down, they will watch over you;
when you awake, they will speak to you.

contents.verseText: For this commandment is a lamp, this teaching is a light, and the reproofs of discipline are the way to life,
contents: For this commandment is a lamp, this teaching is a light,
and the reproofs of discipline are the way to life,

contents.verseText: to keep you from the evil woman, from the smooth tongue of the adulteress.
contents: to keep you from the evil woman,
from the smooth tongue of the adulteress.

footnote.ft: Or the stranger

contents.verseText: Do not lust in your heart for her beauty or let her captivate you with her eyes.
contents: Do not lust in your heart for her beauty
or let her captivate you with her eyes.

footnote.ft: Or eyelids or eyelashes

contents.verseText: For the levy of the prostitute is poverty, and the adulteress preys upon your very life.
contents: For the levy of the prostitute is poverty,

footnote.ft: Literally a crust of bread

contents: and the adulteress preys upon your very life.

contents.verseText: Can a man embrace fire and his clothes not be burned?
contents: Can a man embrace fire
and his clothes not be burned?

contents.verseText: Can a man walk on hot coals without scorching his feet?
contents: Can a man walk on hot coals
without scorching his feet?

contents.verseText: So is he who sleeps with another man’s wife; no one who touches her will go unpunished.
contents: So is he who sleeps with another man’s wife;
no one who touches her will go unpunished.

contents.verseText: Men do not despise the thief if he steals to satisfy his hunger.
contents: Men do not despise the thief
if he steals to satisfy his hunger.

contents.verseText: Yet if caught, he must pay sevenfold; he must give up all the wealth of his house.
contents: Yet if caught, he must pay sevenfold;
he must give up all the wealth of his house.

contents.verseText: He who commits adultery lacks judgment; whoever does so destroys himself.
contents: He who commits adultery lacks judgment;
whoever does so destroys himself.

contents.verseText: Wounds and dishonor will befall him, and his reproach will never be wiped away.
contents: Wounds and dishonor will befall him,
and his reproach will never be wiped away.

contents.verseText: For jealousy enrages a husband, and he will show no mercy in the day of vengeance.
contents: For jealousy enrages a husband,
and he will show no mercy in the day of vengeance.

contents.verseText: He will not be appeased by any ransom, or persuaded by lavish gifts.
contents: He will not be appeased by any ransom,
or persuaded by lavish gifts.

contents.verseText: My son, keep my words and treasure my commandments within you.
contents: My son, keep my words
and treasure my commandments within you.

contents.verseText: Keep my commandments and live; guard my teachings as the apple of your eye.
contents: Keep my commandments and live;
guard my teachings as the apple

footnote.ft: Literally the pupil

contents: of your eye.

contents.verseText: Tie them to your fingers; write them on the tablet of your heart.
contents: Tie them to your fingers;
write them on the tablet of your heart.

contents.verseText: Say to wisdom, “You are my sister,” and call understanding your kinsman,
contents: Say to wisdom, “You are my sister,”
and call understanding your kinsman,

contents.verseText: that they may keep you from the adulteress, from the stranger with seductive words.
contents: that they may keep you from the adulteress,
from the stranger with seductive words.

contents.verseText: For at the window of my house I looked through the lattice.
contents: For at the window of my house
I looked through the lattice.

contents.verseText: I saw among the simple, I noticed among the youths, a young man lacking judgment,
contents: I saw among the simple,
I noticed among the youths,
a young man lacking judgment,

contents.verseText: crossing the street near her corner, strolling down the road to her house,
contents: crossing the street near her corner,
strolling down the road to her house,

contents.verseText: at twilight, as the day was fading into the dark of the night.
contents: at twilight, as the day was fading
into the dark of the night.

contents.verseText: Then a woman came out to meet him, with the attire of a harlot and cunning of heart.
contents: Then a woman came out to meet him,
with the attire of a harlot and cunning of heart.

contents.verseText: She is loud and defiant; her feet do not remain at home.
contents: She is loud and defiant;
her feet do not remain at home.

contents.verseText: Now in the street, now in the squares, she lurks at every corner.
contents: Now in the street, now in the squares,
she lurks at every corner.

contents.verseText: She seizes him and kisses him; she brazenly says to him:
contents: She seizes him and kisses him;
she brazenly says to him:

contents.verseText: “I have made my peace offerings; today I have paid my vows.
contents: “I have made my peace offerings;
today I have paid my vows.

contents.verseText: So I came out to meet you; I sought you, and I have found you.
contents: So I came out to meet you;
I sought you, and I have found you.

contents.verseText: I have decked my bed with coverings, with colored linen from Egypt.
contents: I have decked my bed with coverings,
with colored linen from Egypt.

contents.verseText: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, with aloes, and with cinnamon.
contents: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh,
with aloes, and with cinnamon.

contents.verseText: Come, let us take our fill of love till morning. Let us delight in loving caresses!
contents: Come, let us take our fill of love till morning.
Let us delight in loving caresses!

contents.verseText: For my husband is not at home; he has gone on a long journey.
contents: For my husband is not at home;
he has gone on a long journey.

contents.verseText: He took with him a bag of money and will not return till the moon is full.”
contents: He took with him a bag of money
and will not return till the moon is full.”

contents.verseText: With her great persuasion she entices him; with her flattering lips she lures him.
contents: With her great persuasion she entices him;
with her flattering lips she lures him.

contents.verseText: He follows her on impulse, like an ox going to the slaughter, like a deer bounding into a trap,
contents: He follows her on impulse,
like an ox going to the slaughter,
like a deer bounding into a trap,

footnote.ft: Probable reading (see LXX, Vulgate, Syriac); Hebrew like fetters to discipline a fool

contents.verseText: until an arrow pierces his liver, like a bird darting into a snare—not knowing it will cost him his life.
contents: until an arrow pierces his liver,
like a bird darting into a snare—
not knowing it will cost him his life.

contents.verseText: Now, my sons, listen to me, and attend to the words of my mouth.
contents: Now, my sons, listen to me,
and attend to the words of my mouth.

contents.verseText: Do not let your heart turn aside to her ways; do not stray into her paths.
contents: Do not let your heart turn aside to her ways;
do not stray into her paths.

contents.verseText: For she has brought many down to death; her slain are many in number.
contents: For she has brought many down to death;
her slain are many in number.

contents.verseText: Her house is the road to Sheol, descending to the chambers of death.
contents: Her house is the road to Sheol,
descending to the chambers of death.

contents.verseText: Does not wisdom call out, and understanding raise her voice?
contents: Does not wisdom call out,
and understanding raise her voice?

contents.verseText: On the heights overlooking the road, at the crossroads she takes her stand.
contents: On the heights overlooking the road,
at the crossroads she takes her stand.

contents.verseText: Beside the gates to the city, at the entrances she cries out:
contents: Beside the gates to the city,
at the entrances she cries out:

contents.verseText: “To you, O men, I call out, and my cry is to the sons of men.
contents: “To you, O men, I call out,
and my cry is to the sons of men.

contents.verseText: O simple ones, learn to be shrewd; O fools, gain understanding.
contents: O simple ones, learn to be shrewd;
O fools, gain understanding.

footnote.ft: Or instruct your minds

contents.verseText: Listen, for I speak of noble things, and the opening of my lips will reveal right.
contents: Listen, for I speak of noble things,
and the opening of my lips will reveal right.

contents.verseText: For my mouth will speak the truth, and wickedness is detestable to my lips.
contents: For my mouth will speak the truth,
and wickedness is detestable to my lips.

contents.verseText: All the words of my mouth are righteous; none are crooked or perverse.
contents: All the words of my mouth are righteous;
none are crooked or perverse.

contents.verseText: They are all plain to the discerning, and upright to those who find knowledge.
contents: They are all plain to the discerning,
and upright to those who find knowledge.

contents.verseText: Receive my instruction instead of silver, and knowledge rather than pure gold.
contents: Receive my instruction instead of silver,
and knowledge rather than pure gold.

contents.verseText: For wisdom is more precious than rubies, and nothing you desire compares with her.
contents: For wisdom is more precious than rubies,
and nothing you desire compares with her.

contents.verseText: I, wisdom, dwell together with prudence, and I find knowledge and discretion.
contents: I, wisdom, dwell together with prudence,
and I find knowledge and discretion.

contents.verseText: To fear the LORD is to hate evil; I hate arrogant pride, evil conduct, and perverse speech.
contents: To fear the LORD is to hate evil;
I hate arrogant pride, evil conduct, and perverse speech.

contents.verseText: Counsel and sound judgment are mine; I have insight and strength.
contents: Counsel and sound judgment are mine;
I have insight and strength.

contents.verseText: By me kings reign, and rulers enact just laws;
contents: By me kings reign,
and rulers enact just laws;

contents.verseText: By me princes rule, and all nobles who govern justly.
contents: By me princes rule,
and all nobles who govern justly.

footnote.ft: Some Hebrew manuscripts and LXX who govern the earth

contents.verseText: I love those who love me, and those who seek me early shall find me.
contents: I love those who love me,
and those who seek me early shall find me.

contents.verseText: With me are riches and honor, enduring wealth and righteousness.
contents: With me are riches and honor,
enduring wealth and righteousness.

contents.verseText: My fruit is better than gold, pure gold, and my harvest surpasses choice silver.
contents: My fruit is better than gold, pure gold,
and my harvest surpasses choice silver.

contents.verseText: I walk in the way of righteousness, along the paths of justice,
contents: I walk in the way of righteousness,
along the paths of justice,

contents.verseText: bestowing wealth on those who love me and making their treasuries full.
contents: bestowing wealth on those who love me
and making their treasuries full.

contents.verseText: The LORD created me as His first course, before His works of old.
contents: The LORD created me as His first course,

footnote.ft: Or The LORD possessed me at the beginning of His way

contents: before His works of old.

contents.verseText: From everlasting I was established, from the beginning, before the earth began.
contents: From everlasting I was established,
from the beginning, before the earth began.

contents.verseText: When there were no watery depths, I was brought forth, when no springs were overflowing with water.
contents: When there were no watery depths, I was brought forth,
when no springs were overflowing with water.

contents.verseText: Before the mountains were settled, before the hills, I was brought forth,
contents: Before the mountains were settled,
before the hills, I was brought forth,

contents.verseText: before He made the land or fields, or any of the dust of the earth.
contents: before He made the land or fields,
or any of the dust of the earth.

contents.verseText: I was there when He established the heavens, when He inscribed a circle on the face of the deep,
contents: I was there when He established the heavens,
when He inscribed a circle on the face of the deep,

contents.verseText: when He established the clouds above, when the fountains of the deep gushed forth,
contents: when He established the clouds above,
when the fountains of the deep gushed forth,

contents.verseText: when He set a boundary for the sea, so that the waters would not surpass His command, when He marked out the foundations of the earth.
contents: when He set a boundary for the sea,
so that the waters would not surpass His command,
when He marked out the foundations of the earth.

contents.verseText: Then I was a skilled craftsman at His side, and His delight day by day, rejoicing always in His presence.
contents: Then I was a skilled craftsman at His side,
and His delight

footnote.ft: Or filled with His delight

contents: day by day,
rejoicing always in His presence.

contents.verseText: I was rejoicing in His whole world, delighting together in the sons of men.
contents: I was rejoicing in His whole world,
delighting together in the sons of men.

contents.verseText: Now therefore, my sons, listen to me, for blessed are those who keep my ways.
contents: Now therefore, my sons, listen to me,
for blessed are those who keep my ways.

contents.verseText: Listen to instruction and be wise; do not ignore it.
contents: Listen to instruction and be wise;
do not ignore it.

contents.verseText: Blessed is the man who listens to me, watching daily at my doors, waiting at the posts of my doorway.
contents: Blessed is the man who listens to me,
watching daily at my doors,
waiting at the posts of my doorway.

contents.verseText: For whoever finds me finds life and obtains the favor of the LORD.
contents: For whoever finds me finds life
and obtains the favor of the LORD.

contents.verseText: But he who fails to find me harms himself; all who hate me love death.”
contents: But he who fails to find me harms himself;
all who hate me love death.”

contents.verseText: Wisdom has built her house; she has carved out her seven pillars.
contents: Wisdom has built her house;
she has carved out

footnote.ft: Hebrew; LXX, Syriac, and Aramaic Targum has set up

contents: her seven pillars.

contents.verseText: She has prepared her meat and mixed her wine; she has also set her table.
contents: She has prepared her meat and mixed her wine;
she has also set her table.

contents.verseText: She has sent out her maidservants; she calls out from the heights of the city.
contents: She has sent out her maidservants;
she calls out from the heights of the city.

contents.verseText: “Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!” she says to him who lacks judgment.
contents: “Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!”
she says to him who lacks judgment.

contents.verseText: “Come, eat my bread and drink the wine I have mixed.
contents: “Come, eat my bread
and drink the wine I have mixed.

contents.verseText: Leave your folly behind, and you will live; walk in the way of understanding.”
contents: Leave your folly behind, and you will live;
walk in the way of understanding.”

contents.verseText: He who corrects a mocker brings shame on himself; he who rebukes a wicked man taints himself.
contents: He who corrects a mocker brings shame on himself;
he who rebukes a wicked man taints himself.

contents.verseText: Do not rebuke a mocker, or he will hate you; rebuke a wise man, and he will love you.
contents: Do not rebuke a mocker, or he will hate you;
rebuke a wise man, and he will love you.

contents.verseText: Instruct a wise man, and he will be wiser still; teach a righteous man, and he will increase his learning.
contents: Instruct a wise man, and he will be wiser still;
teach a righteous man, and he will increase his learning.

contents.verseText: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
contents: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom,
and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.

contents.verseText: For through wisdom your days will be multiplied, and years will be added to your life.
contents: For through wisdom

footnote.ft: LXX, Syriac, and Aramaic Targum; Hebrew through me

contents: your days will be multiplied,
and years will be added to your life.

contents.verseText: If you are wise, you are wise to your own advantage; but if you scoff, you alone will bear the consequences.
contents: If you are wise, you are wise to your own advantage;
but if you scoff, you alone will bear the consequences.

contents.verseText: The woman named Folly is loud; she is naive and knows nothing.
contents: The woman named Folly is loud;
she is naive and knows nothing.

contents.verseText: She sits at the door of her house, on a seat in the heights of the city,
contents: She sits at the door of her house,
on a seat in the heights of the city,

contents.verseText: calling out to those who pass by, who make their paths straight.
contents: calling out to those who pass by,
who make their paths straight.

contents.verseText: “Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!” she says to him who lacks judgment.
contents: “Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!”
she says to him who lacks judgment.

contents.verseText: “Stolen water is sweet, and bread eaten in secret is tasty!”
contents: “Stolen water is sweet,
and bread eaten in secret is tasty!”

contents.verseText: But they do not know that the dead are there, that her guests are in the depths of Sheol.
contents: But they do not know that the dead

footnote.ft: Hebrew the Rephaim

contents: are there,
that her guests are in the depths of Sheol.

contents.verseText: The proverbs of Solomon: A wise son brings joy to his father, but a foolish son grief to his mother.
contents: The proverbs of Solomon:
A wise son brings joy to his father,
but a foolish son grief to his mother.

contents.verseText: Ill-gotten treasures profit nothing, but righteousness brings deliverance from death.
contents: Ill-gotten treasures profit nothing,
but righteousness brings deliverance from death.

contents.verseText: The LORD does not let the righteous go hungry, but He denies the craving of the wicked.
contents: The LORD does not let the righteous go hungry,
but He denies the craving of the wicked.

contents.verseText: Idle hands make one poor, but diligent hands bring wealth.
contents: Idle hands make one poor,
but diligent hands bring wealth.

contents.verseText: He who gathers in summer is a wise son, but he who sleeps during harvest is a disgraceful son.
contents: He who gathers in summer is a wise son,
but he who sleeps during harvest is a disgraceful son.

contents.verseText: Blessings are on the head of the righteous, but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
contents: Blessings are on the head of the righteous,
but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.

footnote.ft: Or but violence covers the mouth of the wicked; also in verse 11

contents.verseText: The memory of the righteous is a blessing, but the name of the wicked will rot.
contents: The memory of the righteous is a blessing,
but the name of the wicked will rot.

contents.verseText: A wise heart will receive commandments, but foolish lips will come to ruin.
contents: A wise heart will receive commandments,
but foolish lips will come to ruin.

contents.verseText: He who walks in integrity walks securely, but he who perverts his ways will be found out.
contents: He who walks in integrity walks securely,
but he who perverts his ways will be found out.

contents.verseText: He who winks the eye causes grief, and foolish lips will come to ruin.
contents: He who winks the eye causes grief,
and foolish lips will come to ruin.

footnote.ft: Or babbling fools will fall

contents.verseText: The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life, but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
contents: The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life,
but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.

contents.verseText: Hatred stirs up dissension, but love covers all transgressions.
contents: Hatred stirs up dissension,
but love covers all transgressions.

footnote.ft: See 1 Peter 4:8

contents.verseText: Wisdom is found on the lips of the discerning, but a rod is for the back of him who lacks judgment.
contents: Wisdom is found on the lips of the discerning,
but a rod is for the back of him who lacks judgment.

contents.verseText: The wise store up knowledge, but the mouth of the fool invites destruction.
contents: The wise store up knowledge,
but the mouth of the fool invites destruction.

contents.verseText: The wealth of the rich man is his fortified city, but poverty is the ruin of the poor.
contents: The wealth of the rich man is his fortified city,
but poverty is the ruin of the poor.

contents.verseText: The labor of the righteous leads to life, but the gain of the wicked brings punishment.
contents: The labor of the righteous leads to life,
but the gain of the wicked brings punishment.

contents.verseText: Whoever heeds instruction is on the path to life, but he who ignores reproof goes astray.
contents: Whoever heeds instruction is on the path to life,
but he who ignores reproof goes astray.

contents.verseText: The one who conceals hatred has lying lips, and whoever spreads slander is a fool.
contents: The one who conceals hatred has lying lips,
and whoever spreads slander is a fool.

contents.verseText: When words are many, sin is unavoidable, but he who restrains his lips is wise.
contents: When words are many, sin is unavoidable,
but he who restrains his lips is wise.

contents.verseText: The tongue of the righteous is choice silver, but the heart of the wicked has little worth.
contents: The tongue of the righteous is choice silver,
but the heart of the wicked has little worth.

contents.verseText: The lips of the righteous feed many, but fools die for lack of judgment.
contents: The lips of the righteous feed many,
but fools die for lack of judgment.

contents.verseText: The blessing of the LORD enriches, and He adds no sorrow to it.
contents: The blessing of the LORD enriches,
and He adds no sorrow to it.

contents.verseText: The fool delights in shameful conduct, but a man of understanding has wisdom.
contents: The fool delights in shameful conduct,
but a man of understanding has wisdom.

contents.verseText: What the wicked man dreads will overtake him, but the desire of the righteous will be granted.
contents: What the wicked man dreads will overtake him,
but the desire of the righteous will be granted.

contents.verseText: When the whirlwind passes, the wicked are no more, but the righteous are secure forever.
contents: When the whirlwind passes, the wicked are no more,
but the righteous are secure forever.

contents.verseText: Like vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes, so is the slacker to those who send him.
contents: Like vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes,
so is the slacker to those who send him.

contents.verseText: The fear of the LORD prolongs life, but the years of the wicked will be cut short.
contents: The fear of the LORD prolongs life,
but the years of the wicked will be cut short.

contents.verseText: The hope of the righteous is joy, but the expectations of the wicked will perish.
contents: The hope of the righteous is joy,
but the expectations of the wicked will perish.

contents.verseText: The way of the LORD is a refuge to the upright, but destruction awaits those who do evil.
contents: The way of the LORD is a refuge to the upright,
but destruction awaits those who do evil.

contents.verseText: The righteous will never be shaken, but the wicked will not inhabit the land.
contents: The righteous will never be shaken,
but the wicked will not inhabit the land.

contents.verseText: The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom, but a perverse tongue will be cut out.
contents: The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom,
but a perverse tongue will be cut out.

contents.verseText: The lips of the righteous know what is fitting, but the mouth of the wicked is perverse.
contents: The lips of the righteous know what is fitting,
but the mouth of the wicked is perverse.

contents.verseText: Dishonest scales are an abomination to the LORD, but an accurate weight is His delight.
contents: Dishonest scales are an abomination to the LORD,
but an accurate weight is His delight.

contents.verseText: When pride comes, disgrace follows, but with humility comes wisdom.
contents: When pride comes, disgrace follows,
but with humility comes wisdom.

contents.verseText: The integrity of the upright guides them, but the perversity of the faithless destroys them.
contents: The integrity of the upright guides them,
but the perversity of the faithless destroys them.

contents.verseText: Riches are worthless in the day of wrath, but righteousness brings deliverance from death.
contents: Riches are worthless in the day of wrath,
but righteousness brings deliverance from death.

contents.verseText: The righteousness of the blameless directs their path, but the wicked fall by their own wickedness.
contents: The righteousness of the blameless directs their path,
but the wicked fall by their own wickedness.

contents.verseText: The righteousness of the upright delivers them, but the faithless are trapped by their own desires.
contents: The righteousness of the upright delivers them,
but the faithless are trapped by their own desires.

contents.verseText: When the wicked man dies, his hope perishes, and the hope of his strength vanishes.
contents: When the wicked man dies, his hope perishes,
and the hope of his strength vanishes.

contents.verseText: The righteous man is delivered from trouble; in his place the wicked man goes in.
contents: The righteous man is delivered from trouble;
in his place the wicked man goes in.

contents.verseText: With his mouth the ungodly man destroys his neighbor, but through knowledge the righteous are rescued.
contents: With his mouth the ungodly man destroys his neighbor,
but through knowledge the righteous are rescued.

contents.verseText: When the righteous thrive, the city rejoices, and when the wicked perish, there are shouts of joy.
contents: When the righteous thrive, the city rejoices,
and when the wicked perish, there are shouts of joy.

contents.verseText: By the blessing of the upright a city is built up, but by the mouth of the wicked it is torn down.
contents: By the blessing of the upright a city is built up,
but by the mouth of the wicked it is torn down.

contents.verseText: Whoever shows contempt for his neighbor lacks judgment, but a man of understanding remains silent.
contents: Whoever shows contempt for his neighbor lacks judgment,
but a man of understanding remains silent.

contents.verseText: A gossip reveals a secret, but a trustworthy person keeps a confidence.
contents: A gossip reveals a secret,
but a trustworthy person keeps a confidence.

contents.verseText: For lack of guidance, a nation falls, but with many counselors comes deliverance.
contents: For lack of guidance, a nation falls,
but with many counselors comes deliverance.

contents.verseText: He who puts up security for a stranger will surely suffer, but the one who hates indebtedness is secure.
contents: He who puts up security for a stranger will surely suffer,
but the one who hates indebtedness is secure.

contents.verseText: A gracious woman attains honor, but ruthless men gain only wealth.
contents: A gracious woman attains honor,
but ruthless men gain only wealth.

contents.verseText: A kind man benefits himself, but a cruel man brings trouble on himself.
contents: A kind man benefits himself,
but a cruel man brings trouble on himself.

contents.verseText: The wicked man earns an empty wage, but he who sows righteousness reaps a true reward.
contents: The wicked man earns an empty wage,
but he who sows righteousness reaps a true reward.

contents.verseText: Genuine righteousness leads to life, but the pursuit of evil brings death.
contents: Genuine righteousness leads to life,
but the pursuit of evil brings death.

contents.verseText: The perverse in heart are an abomination to the LORD, but the blameless in their walk are His delight.
contents: The perverse in heart are an abomination to the LORD,
but the blameless in their walk are His delight.

contents.verseText: Be assured that the wicked will not go unpunished, but the offspring of the righteous will escape.
contents: Be assured that the wicked will not go unpunished,
but the offspring of the righteous will escape.

contents.verseText: Like a gold ring in a pig’s snout is a beautiful woman who lacks discretion.
contents: Like a gold ring in a pig’s snout
is a beautiful woman who lacks discretion.

contents.verseText: The desire of the righteous leads only to good, but the hope of the wicked brings wrath.
contents: The desire of the righteous leads only to good,
but the hope of the wicked brings wrath.

contents.verseText: One gives freely, yet gains even more; another withholds what is right, only to become poor.
contents: One gives freely, yet gains even more;
another withholds what is right, only to become poor.

contents.verseText: A generous soul will prosper, and he who refreshes others will himself be refreshed.
contents: A generous soul will prosper,
and he who refreshes others will himself be refreshed.

contents.verseText: The people will curse the hoarder of grain, but blessing will crown the one who sells it.
contents: The people will curse the hoarder of grain,
but blessing will crown the one who sells it.

contents.verseText: He who searches out good finds favor, but evil will come to him who seeks it.
contents: He who searches out good finds favor,
but evil will come to him who seeks it.

contents.verseText: He who trusts in his riches will fall, but the righteous will thrive like foliage.
contents: He who trusts in his riches will fall,
but the righteous will thrive like foliage.

contents.verseText: He who brings trouble on his house will inherit the wind, and the fool will be servant to the wise of heart.
contents: He who brings trouble on his house will inherit the wind,
and the fool will be servant to the wise of heart.

contents.verseText: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, and he who wins souls is wise.
contents: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life,
and he who wins souls is wise.

contents.verseText: If the righteous receive their due on earth, how much more the ungodly and the sinner!
contents: If the righteous receive their due on earth,
how much more the ungodly and the sinner!

footnote.ft: LXX If it is hard for the righteous to be saved, what will become of the ungodly and the sinner? Cited in 1 Peter 4:18

contents.verseText: Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge, but he who hates correction is stupid.
contents: Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge,
but he who hates correction is stupid.

contents.verseText: The good man obtains favor from the LORD, but the LORD condemns a man who devises evil.
contents: The good man obtains favor from the LORD,
but the LORD condemns a man who devises evil.

contents.verseText: A man cannot be established through wickedness, but the righteous cannot be uprooted.
contents: A man cannot be established through wickedness,
but the righteous cannot be uprooted.

contents.verseText: A wife of noble character is her husband’s crown, but she who causes shame is like decay in his bones.
contents: A wife of noble character is her husband’s crown,
but she who causes shame is like decay in his bones.

contents.verseText: The plans of the righteous are just, but the counsel of the wicked leads to deceit.
contents: The plans of the righteous are just,
but the counsel of the wicked leads to deceit.

contents.verseText: The words of the wicked lie in wait for blood, but the speech of the upright rescues them.
contents: The words of the wicked lie in wait for blood,
but the speech of the upright rescues them.

contents.verseText: The wicked are overthrown and perish, but the house of the righteous will stand.
contents: The wicked are overthrown and perish,
but the house of the righteous will stand.

contents.verseText: A man is praised according to his wisdom, but a twisted mind is despised.
contents: A man is praised according to his wisdom,
but a twisted mind is despised.

contents.verseText: Better to be lightly esteemed yet have a servant, than to be self-important but lack food.
contents: Better to be lightly esteemed yet have a servant,
than to be self-important but lack food.

contents.verseText: A righteous man regards the life of his animal, but the tender mercies of the wicked are only cruelty.
contents: A righteous man regards the life of his animal,
but the tender mercies of the wicked are only cruelty.

contents.verseText: The one who works his land will have plenty of food, but whoever chases fantasies lacks judgment.
contents: The one who works his land will have plenty of food,
but whoever chases fantasies lacks judgment.

contents.verseText: The wicked desire the plunder of evil men, but the root of the righteous flourishes.
contents: The wicked desire the plunder of evil men,
but the root of the righteous flourishes.

contents.verseText: An evil man is trapped by his rebellious speech, but a righteous man escapes from trouble.
contents: An evil man is trapped by his rebellious speech,
but a righteous man escapes from trouble.

contents.verseText: By fruitful speech a man is filled with good things, and the work of his hands returns to him.
contents: By fruitful speech a man is filled with good things,
and the work of his hands returns to him.

contents.verseText: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes, but a wise man listens to counsel.
contents: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes,
but a wise man listens to counsel.

contents.verseText: A fool’s anger is known at once, but a prudent man overlooks an insult.
contents: A fool’s anger is known at once,
but a prudent man overlooks an insult.

contents.verseText: He who speaks the truth declares what is right, but a false witness speaks deceit.
contents: He who speaks the truth declares what is right,
but a false witness speaks deceit.

contents.verseText: Speaking rashly is like a piercing sword, but the tongue of the wise brings healing.
contents: Speaking rashly is like a piercing sword,
but the tongue of the wise brings healing.

contents.verseText: Truthful lips endure forever, but a lying tongue lasts only a moment.
contents: Truthful lips endure forever,
but a lying tongue lasts only a moment.

contents.verseText: Deceit is in the hearts of those who devise evil, but the counselors of peace have joy.
contents: Deceit is in the hearts of those who devise evil,
but the counselors of peace have joy.

contents.verseText: No harm befalls the righteous, but the wicked are filled with trouble.
contents: No harm befalls the righteous,
but the wicked are filled with trouble.

contents.verseText: Lying lips are detestable to the LORD, but those who deal faithfully are His delight.
contents: Lying lips are detestable to the LORD,
but those who deal faithfully are His delight.

contents.verseText: A shrewd man keeps his knowledge to himself, but a foolish heart proclaims its folly.
contents: A shrewd man keeps his knowledge to himself,
but a foolish heart proclaims its folly.

contents.verseText: The hand of the diligent will rule, but laziness ends in forced labor.
contents: The hand of the diligent will rule,
but laziness ends in forced labor.

contents.verseText: Anxiety weighs down the heart of a man, but a good word cheers it up.
contents: Anxiety weighs down the heart of a man,
but a good word cheers it up.

contents.verseText: A righteous man is cautious in friendship, but the ways of the wicked lead them astray.
contents: A righteous man is cautious in friendship,
but the ways of the wicked lead them astray.

contents.verseText: A lazy man does not roast his game, but a diligent man prizes his possession.
contents: A lazy man does not roast his game,
but a diligent man prizes his possession.

contents.verseText: There is life in the path of righteousness, but another path leads to death.
contents: There is life in the path of righteousness,
but another path leads to death.

contents.verseText: A wise son heeds his father’s discipline, but a mocker does not listen to rebuke.
contents: A wise son heeds his father’s discipline,
but a mocker does not listen to rebuke.

contents.verseText: From the fruit of his lips a man enjoys good things, but the desire of the faithless is violence.
contents: From the fruit of his lips a man enjoys good things,
but the desire of the faithless is violence.

contents.verseText: He who guards his mouth protects his life, but the one who opens his lips invites his own ruin.
contents: He who guards his mouth protects his life,
but the one who opens his lips invites his own ruin.

contents.verseText: The slacker craves yet has nothing, but the soul of the diligent is fully satisfied.
contents: The slacker craves yet has nothing,
but the soul of the diligent is fully satisfied.

contents.verseText: The righteous hate falsehood, but the wicked bring shame and disgrace.
contents: The righteous hate falsehood,
but the wicked bring shame and disgrace.

contents.verseText: Righteousness guards the man of integrity, but wickedness undermines the sinner.
contents: Righteousness guards the man of integrity,
but wickedness undermines the sinner.

contents.verseText: One pretends to be rich, but has nothing; another pretends to be poor, yet has great wealth.
contents: One pretends to be rich, but has nothing;
another pretends to be poor, yet has great wealth.

contents.verseText: Riches may ransom a man’s life, but a poor man hears no threat.
contents: Riches may ransom a man’s life,
but a poor man hears no threat.

contents.verseText: The light of the righteous shines brightly, but the lamp of the wicked is extinguished.
contents: The light of the righteous shines brightly,
but the lamp of the wicked is extinguished.

contents.verseText: Arrogance leads only to strife, but wisdom is with the well-advised.
contents: Arrogance leads only to strife,
but wisdom is with the well-advised.

contents.verseText: Dishonest wealth will dwindle, but what is earned through hard work will be multiplied.
contents: Dishonest wealth will dwindle,
but what is earned through hard work will be multiplied.

contents.verseText: Hope deferred makes the heart sick, but desire fulfilled is a tree of life.
contents: Hope deferred makes the heart sick,
but desire fulfilled is a tree of life.

contents.verseText: He who despises instruction will pay the penalty, but the one who respects a command will be rewarded.
contents: He who despises instruction will pay the penalty,
but the one who respects a command will be rewarded.

contents.verseText: The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life, turning one from the snares of death.
contents: The teaching

footnote.ft: Or law

contents: of the wise is a fountain of life,
turning one from the snares of death.

contents.verseText: Good understanding wins favor, but the way of the faithless is difficult.
contents: Good understanding wins favor,
but the way of the faithless is difficult.

contents.verseText: Every prudent man acts with knowledge, but a fool displays his folly.
contents: Every prudent man acts with knowledge,
but a fool displays his folly.

contents.verseText: A wicked messenger falls into trouble, but a faithful envoy brings healing.
contents: A wicked messenger falls into trouble,
but a faithful envoy brings healing.

contents.verseText: Poverty and shame come to him who ignores discipline, but whoever heeds correction is honored.
contents: Poverty and shame come to him who ignores discipline,
but whoever heeds correction is honored.

contents.verseText: Desire fulfilled is sweet to the soul, but turning from evil is detestable to fools.
contents: Desire fulfilled is sweet to the soul,
but turning from evil is detestable to fools.

contents.verseText: He who walks with the wise will become wise, but the companion of fools will be destroyed.
contents: He who walks with the wise will become wise,
but the companion of fools will be destroyed.

contents.verseText: Disaster pursues sinners, but prosperity is the reward of the righteous.
contents: Disaster pursues sinners,
but prosperity is the reward of the righteous.

contents.verseText: A good man leaves an inheritance to his children’s children, but the sinner’s wealth is passed to the righteous.
contents: A good man leaves an inheritance to his children’s children,
but the sinner’s wealth is passed to the righteous.

contents.verseText: Abundant food is in the fallow ground of the poor, but without justice it is swept away.
contents: Abundant food is in the fallow ground of the poor,
but without justice it is swept away.

contents.verseText: He who spares the rod hates his son, but he who loves him disciplines him diligently.
contents: He who spares the rod hates his son,
but he who loves him disciplines him diligently.

contents.verseText: A righteous man eats to his heart’s content, but the stomach of the wicked is empty.
contents: A righteous man eats to his heart’s content,
but the stomach of the wicked is empty.

contents.verseText: Every wise woman builds her house, but a foolish one tears it down with her own hands.
contents: Every wise woman builds her house,
but a foolish one tears it down with her own hands.

contents.verseText: He who walks in uprightness fears the LORD, but the one who is devious in his ways despises Him.
contents: He who walks in uprightness fears the LORD,
but the one who is devious in his ways despises Him.

contents.verseText: The proud speech of a fool brings a rod to his back, but the lips of the wise protect them.
contents: The proud speech of a fool brings a rod to his back,
but the lips of the wise protect them.

contents.verseText: Where there are no oxen, the manger is empty, but an abundant harvest comes through the strength of the ox.
contents: Where there are no oxen, the manger is empty,
but an abundant harvest comes through the strength of the ox.

contents.verseText: An honest witness does not deceive, but a dishonest witness pours forth lies.
contents: An honest witness does not deceive,
but a dishonest witness pours forth lies.

contents.verseText: A mocker seeks wisdom and finds none, but knowledge comes easily to the discerning.
contents: A mocker seeks wisdom and finds none,
but knowledge comes easily to the discerning.

contents.verseText: Stay away from a foolish man; you will gain no knowledge from his speech.
contents: Stay away from a foolish man;
you will gain no knowledge from his speech.

contents.verseText: The wisdom of the prudent is to discern his way, but the folly of fools deceives them.
contents: The wisdom of the prudent is to discern his way,
but the folly of fools deceives them.

contents.verseText: Fools mock the making of amends, but goodwill is found among the upright.
contents: Fools mock the making of amends,
but goodwill is found among the upright.

contents.verseText: The heart knows its own bitterness, and no stranger shares in its joy.
contents: The heart knows its own bitterness,
and no stranger shares in its joy.

contents.verseText: The house of the wicked will be destroyed, but the tent of the upright will flourish.
contents: The house of the wicked will be destroyed,
but the tent of the upright will flourish.

contents.verseText: There is a way that seems right to a man, but its end is the way of death.
contents: There is a way that seems right to a man,
but its end is the way of death.

contents.verseText: Even in laughter the heart may ache, and joy may end in sorrow.
contents: Even in laughter the heart may ache,
and joy may end in sorrow.

contents.verseText: The backslider in heart receives the fill of his own ways, but a good man is rewarded for his ways.
contents: The backslider in heart receives the fill of his own ways,
but a good man is rewarded for his ways.

contents.verseText: The simple man believes every word, but the prudent man watches his steps.
contents: The simple man believes every word,
but the prudent man watches his steps.

contents.verseText: A wise man fears and turns from evil, but a fool is careless and reckless.
contents: A wise man fears

footnote.ft: Or fears the LORD

contents: and turns from evil,
but a fool is careless and reckless.

contents.verseText: A quick-tempered man acts foolishly, and a devious man is hated.
contents: A quick-tempered man acts foolishly,
and a devious man is hated.

contents.verseText: The simple inherit folly, but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
contents: The simple inherit folly,
but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

contents.verseText: The evil bow before the good, and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
contents: The evil bow before the good,
and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

contents.verseText: The poor man is hated even by his neighbor, but many are those who love the rich.
contents: The poor man is hated even by his neighbor,
but many are those who love the rich.

contents.verseText: He who despises his neighbor sins, but blessed is he who shows kindness to the poor.
contents: He who despises his neighbor sins,
but blessed is he who shows kindness to the poor.

contents.verseText: Do not those who contrive evil go astray? But those who plan goodness find loving devotion and faithfulness.
contents: Do not those who contrive evil go astray?
But those who plan goodness find

footnote.ft: Or show

contents: loving devotion and faithfulness.

contents.verseText: There is profit in all labor, but mere talk leads only to poverty.
contents: There is profit in all labor,
but mere talk leads only to poverty.

contents.verseText: The crown of the wise is their wealth, but the effort of fools is folly.
contents: The crown of the wise is their wealth,
but the effort of fools is folly.

contents.verseText: A truthful witness saves lives, but one who utters lies is deceitful.
contents: A truthful witness saves lives,
but one who utters lies is deceitful.

contents.verseText: He who fears the LORD is secure in confidence, and his children shall have a place of refuge.
contents: He who fears the LORD is secure in confidence,
and his children shall have a place of refuge.

contents.verseText: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, turning a man from the snares of death.
contents: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life,
turning a man from the snares of death.

contents.verseText: A large population is a king’s splendor, but a lack of subjects is a prince’s ruin.
contents: A large population is a king’s splendor,
but a lack of subjects is a prince’s ruin.

contents.verseText: A patient man has great understanding, but a quick-tempered man promotes folly.
contents: A patient man has great understanding,
but a quick-tempered man promotes folly.

contents.verseText: A tranquil heart is life to the body, but envy rots the bones.
contents: A tranquil heart is life to the body,
but envy rots the bones.

contents.verseText: Whoever oppresses the poor taunts their Maker, but whoever is kind to the needy honors Him.
contents: Whoever oppresses the poor taunts their Maker,
but whoever is kind to the needy honors Him.

contents.verseText: The wicked man is thrown down by his own sin, but the righteous man has a refuge even in death.
contents: The wicked man is thrown down by his own sin,
but the righteous man has a refuge even in death.

contents.verseText: Wisdom rests in the heart of the discerning; even among fools she is known.
contents: Wisdom rests in the heart of the discerning;
even among fools she is known.

footnote.ft: Hebrew; LXX and Syriac but among fools she is not known
